## EmitOnStatusCode() function

Emits a given vue event after the execution of the decorated method, if a status code can be extracted from its return value or error.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
declare function EmitOnStatusCode(code?: number, event?: string, rethrow?: boolean): TypedPropertyDecorator<FunctionWithContext<Vue>>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  code | <code>number</code> | The status code to match, if none is given, it will emit on every status code |
|  event | <code>string</code> | The name of the event to trigger, defaults to <code>status:STATUSCODE</code> where STATUSCODE is the status code extracted from the return value or error of the decorated method. |
|  rethrow | <code>boolean</code> | If the error should be re-thrown after emitting the event |

<b>Returns:</b>

`TypedPropertyDecorator<FunctionWithContext<Vue>>`

## Remarks

If a promise is returned, it will trigger the event after the promise was rejected or resolved.

## Example


```typescript
@Component({})
export default class FooBar extends Vue {
  @EmitOnStatusCode(200, "success")
  @EmitOnStatusCode([400, 500], "failure")
  private async saveFooBar() {
    // ... Implementation
    return axios.get("/foo/bar");
  }
}

```
